content:
I have not seen others with this problem. To find your profile, do this:

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down left side to 'profile folder'
  3. click 'open folder' - you are now in the profile and windows file explorer will display the folder name in upper area of screen
creator: davidsk

content: MS sent messages to users about server changes. Try these: - incoming: outlook.office365.com, port 993, SSL/TLS, Oauth2 (assuming IMAP) - outgoing: smtp.office365.com, port 587, STARTTLS, Oauth2
creator: davidsk

content:
Ciao, anzitutto questo non è un supporto tecnico ma solo un forum per gli utenti.

Thunderbird è un programma che gira localmente sul tuo computer. Nessuno a parte te può accedere alle sue funzioni. Questo per dirti che nessuno può verificare da remoto cosa hai fatto di preciso.

Personalmente non ho idea di cosa tu intenda con "ho risposto SI ad una domanda affinché la mia mail di cui in oggetto venisse in qualche modo associata a tunderbird"

Quando dici che non riesci ad accedere a cosa ti riferisci? Cosa provi a fare? cosa non funziona? Ricevi messaggi di errore?

Tieni conto infine che l'accesso alle caselle TIM da client (come Thunderbird) richiede che tu abbia un abbonatento Tim fisso o mobile associato alla mail o in alternativa che tu stia usando una connessione Tim. Se sei all'estero quindi potresti non poter accedere da client ma solo da web.
creator: @next

content:
First, I don't recommend it, as you will need to upgrade eventually and 128 is being actively upgraded. But, since you want to revert here are the steps used in Windows - I don't know how to restate for a Mac:

  1. Exit Thunderbird if running.
  2. click windows key and 'r' key
  3. Enter: thunderbird.exe -P --allow-downgrade
  4. click on 'OK'

I am surprised that your backup software didn't back up the profile as well. We are routinely seeing that proprietary backups often fail users. All the best on doing the restore.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks David - it did backup the profile - but I didn't want to revert back to the profile - since the new profile contains new emails. Using standard Mac Timemachine. I'll hang in there and see the improvement.

content:
All of the emails when received show "Undisclosed Recipient" as the Sender instead of Displaying my name as the sender.

"Undisclosed Recipients" should be in the To: field, not in the From: field. It certainly is that way here using a Gmail account.

More information about just how broken things are:

When reinstalling I've tried unselecting the "Mozilla Maintenance Service" as well as the various shortcuts for the app, but the bloody service and desktop shortcut are still installed/created.
creator: belg4mit

content: Okay Mozilla, you're being really skeevy here. I deselect bloody maintenance service, it still gets installed. I replace maintenanceservice.exe and maintenanceservice_installer.exe with 0 byte read only files immediately after installing, and you STILL manage to install the service and upgrade from 128SR3 to the non-functional 131 which admonishes me for not staying on the mainline branch... WTF?
creator: belg4mit

content:
I finally got v128 to stick (for now), but it was far more involved than should be required!

Install 128 w/o maintenance service. Wait for the damned service to appear anyways when closing the installer. Uninstall the maintenance service from Windows Programs & Features. Replace place dummy maintenanceservice files in the Thunderbird folder as above. Open the v128 installer in an archive application like Peazip, extract everything but the bloody maintenance files into a temporary folder. Replace the files in C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird with those from the archive to "downgrade" back to the version you actually thought you were installing.
creator: belg4mit
